alert.note: Alert for City of Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 8:54AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding as a result of 2 to 3 inches of rain that fell across the Roanoke area and upstream basins overnight and early this morning. * WHERE...City of Roanoke, especially the downtown area and areas adjacent to the Roanoke River and its tributaries. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 AM EDT, At 900 AM EDT this morning, the Roanoke River at Roanoke had reached 6.1 feet and was rising slowly. Action stage at this location is 6.0 feet. Flood stage is 10.0 feet. The river is expected to crest below flood stage. The river is not expected to reach flood stage with this rainfall event. However, the elevated level of the river may result in minor flooding near the river and along its tributaries within Roanoke City. - Roanoke River in Downtown Roanoke is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Roanoke River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
